About Me

Matija Zigic went to Faculty of Electrical Engineering and Computing, University of Zagreb. He received his Master’s degree in 2012. His primary focus was robotics and robust voice activity detection for applications in mobile robotics.

After completing his Master’s thesis he started working in Intis where he worked on different industrial automation tasks worldwide. He was writing software for company that offers state-of-the-art plant solutions for the metal industry.

In 2014, he started working for Croatian based startup Farmeron. There, he developed cloud-based farm business management software. More precisely, worked on developing mobile applications, backend development and integration with different hardware devices using various technologies.

In 2017, he accepted the offer from Aeolus robotics and started working on bringing the first generation of household robot assistants into people’s home. Worked on an interface between robot’s brain and low-level controllers and simulations. In Gideon Brothers, he is designing different parts of automated robotics system for logistics purposes. Working on challenging DATMO (Detection and tracking of moving objects) problem in crowded environments using different sensors like LIDARs, Stereo and RGBD cameras. Participated in solving various computer vision problems and real-time enhancements. As part of navigation team he is working on planning and control tasks.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3nW9LyWV72g

Continuous casting is the process where a metal is heated until it liquefies.
